original_title: Big Six: Lance Armstrong's Greatest Moments
overview: When professional cyclist Lance Armstrong learned he had testicular cancer in 1996, he had to withdraw from the prestigious Tour de France. Yet, three years later, he emerged cancer-free and went on to win the race a record six times in a row, becoming one of America's most inspiring public figures. This program chronicles Armstrong's riveting story from start to finish, relying on footage from all stages of his career.
title: Big Six: Lance Armstrong's Greatest Moments
